Visualize Distribution of Missing Values Across Time

Source: R/subplot_na_timing.R
ggplot_na_timing.Rd

Creates a stacked barplot visualization of missing values across time intervals. Particularly useful for examining patterns in missing data across large datasets. Adapted from the ggplot_na_distribution2 function in the imputeTS package (Moritz & Gatscha, GPL-3).

Usage

ggplot_na_timing(
  data,
  number_intervals = NULL,
  interval_size = NULL,
  measure = "percent",
  color_missing = "indianred2",
  color_existing = "steelblue",
  alpha_missing = 0.8,
  alpha_existing = 0.3,
  title = "Missing Values per Interval",
  subtitle = "Amount of NA and non-NA for successive intervals",
  xlab = "Time Lapse (Interval Size: XX)",
  ylab = NULL,
  color_border = "white",
  theme = ggplot2::theme_linedraw(),
  keypoint = NULL
)

Arguments

data

Numeric vector containing NAs.

number_intervals

Integer specifying number of bins. Default (NULL) uses Sturges' formula via nclass.Sturges(). Ignored if interval_size is set.

interval_size

Integer specifying number of observations per bin. If set, overrides number_intervals.

measure

Character string specifying display units:

  • "percent": Show as percentages (default)

  • "count": Show absolute numbers

color_missing

Color for missing values (default: "indianred2")

color_existing

Color for existing values (default: "steelblue")

alpha_missing

Transparency for missing values (default: 0.8)

alpha_existing

Transparency for existing values (default: 0.3)

title

Plot title (default: "Missing Values per Interval")

subtitle

Plot subtitle (default: "Amount of NA and non-NA for successive intervals")

xlab

X-axis label (default shows interval size)

ylab

Y-axis label (automatically set based on measure)

color_border

Color for interval borders (default: "white")

theme

ggplot2 theme (default: theme_linedraw())

keypoint

Optional keypoint name for subtitle

Value

A ggplot2 object that can be further customized using ggplot2 syntax

Details

This function creates a stacked barplot showing the distribution of missing values across time. Instead of showing individual observations, it groups them into intervals/bins, making it easier to visualize patterns in large datasets.

The size of intervals can be controlled either by specifying the total number of intervals (number_intervals) or by setting a fixed number of observations per interval (interval_size).

Note

This function is adapted from the imputeTS package (version 3.3) by Steffen Moritz and Sebastian Gatscha, available under GPL-3 license.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage with default settings
ggplot_na_timing(movement_data)

# Show counts instead of percentages
ggplot_na_timing(movement_data, measure = "count")

# Custom interval size
ggplot_na_timing(movement_data, interval_size = 300)

# Customize colors and transparency
ggplot_na_timing(movement_data,
                 color_missing = "red",
                 color_existing = "blue",
                 alpha_missing = 0.6)

# Add custom ggplot2 modifications
ggplot_na_timing(movement_data) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45))
} # }
